intro: Pharium elegans, commonly known as the elegant pharium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that are often evergreen, providing visual interest throughout the year. Pharium elegans is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
